column2: while the weather is yet cold
column3: and before the trees have begun to show many signs of life
column4: it is the time for tapping the maples.The sun
column5: which has already begun to make his power felt by melting the snow
column6: and leaving great green patches here and there on the cleared lands
column7: has kissed the rugged trunks of the trees
column8: and has set the sweet sap mounting through every vein and tissue.Now is the time to set the troughs in order
column9: and to bore the holes for the little spouts through which the juice must run. These must be made a foot from the ground
column10: on the sunny side of the tree; and very soon the drip
column12: of the oozing sap will be heard
column13: as it trickles over the spout into the rough bowls placed to catch it at the foot of every maple.
